title: Caterpillar to Move Headquarters to Texas From Illinois; Construction equipment maker's move follows Boeing's decision to relocate to Arlington, Va., from Chicago
text:
"We believe it's in the best strategic interest of the company to make this move," said Caterpillar Chief Executive Jim Umpleby.

The 97-year-old company was based in Peoria, Ill., for decades before shifting its headquarters in 2018 to Deerfield, Ill., a Chicago suburb. Caterpillar said it would begin moving its headquarters to Texas this year.

Caterpillar continues to have many salaried employees based out of Peoria as well as other factories in the state.

Boeing Co. said in May that it would move its global headquarters to Arlington, Va., from Chicago. The plane maker's move aims to bring its leadership closer to federal officials and an engineering talent pool, with other major military contractors already based in the area.

Write to Austen Hufford at austen.hufford@wsj.com

Caterpillar to Move Headquarters to Texas From Illinois
